item.title: Here we go again
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Unhandled:

Tbh I’d make a new account if I wanted the slightest amount of respect on this site.

this reminds me of how the media talk, like,
“Everyone is talking about it”
“Everyone’s laughing at you”

no everyone is not laughing at me, you really cant say that everyone is doing something, unless its breathing or eating.
so you cant say Taharok has no respect, i for one respect him because i think he is fairly knowledgable and will probably learn more stuff as time goes by.

item.title: Here we go again
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:10, topic:193112”][quote author=Frell link=topic=257072.msg2138338#msg2138338 date=1206602320]

That’s what I figured… But doing that makes it platform dependent. Why don’t you just display a text editor and open the file with your java program?

moparscapers only use windows

Anything else may hurt their java guru brains.

I think he was implying you are a moparscaper frell…

I quit making servers a long time ago because of my router, only allowed 10 connections max.
So i just find pleasure in helpin’ the lil’ fellers’ out.

And he knew the program that i was making

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Notice if you scroll down he said ‘VIRUS DONT DL’
He was referring to you, how you said its platform dependent, he said almost all moparscapers use windows.
[/quote]

Lol you don’t get it frell. I basically said ‘why make platform dependent programs’ and this one would be windows dependent. Thus, lawl said that only moparscapers use windows. Since you are the creator of the program, this insult was also directed toward you. Get my drift?[/quote]
Yea i get it, when i read my post, i think what i said came out wrong. He could have been telling you why it didnt need to be multi platform because he knew the program i made was for moparscapers.

Read full topic

item.title: Here we go again
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Nerice, post:6, topic:193112”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=257072.msg2137311#msg2137311 date=1206581375]
That’s what I figured… But doing that makes it platform dependent. Why don’t you just display a text editor and open the file with your java program?
[/quote]

Properties you can find out the system your running on, then decide what application to try to launch.[/quote]

But why bother? Notepad is the simplest program in the entire world. You can easily just instantiate your own JFrame with JTextArea in it, instead of going through the extra effort of calling system properties and then using Runtime to open the proper text editor.

[quote=“Frell, post:7, topic:193112”][quote author=lawl link=topic=257072.msg2137316#msg2137316 date=1206581576]

That’s what I figured… But doing that makes it platform dependent. Why don’t you just display a text editor and open the file with your java program?

moparscapers only use windows
[/quote]
Anything else may hurt their java guru brains.[/quote]

I think he was implying you are a moparscaper frell…

Read full topic

item.title: Here we go again
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:2, topic:193112”][quote author=Frell link=topic=257072.msg2136945#msg2136945 date=1206566441]
Im trying to open a file through notepad, since this was unsuccessful in VB.

 try
{
	Runtime.getRuntime().exec("notepad X:\fhello.txt");
} catch (IOException ex)
{
	ex.printStackTrace();
}

When i originally googled i found that, made since but when i ran and it tried to open the file, notepad opened, but then an error box said system could not find the path… It used to say /file.txt but when i changed it to /hello.txt i got an error because of the / things, so i thought /f was the thing for ‘file’ so i left it there and, your turn
[/quote]

Firstly, if you want to use a backslash in a String, you need to do \ not \f. Second, what is the X: all about?[/quote]
Im not sure, it was there from the beginning, that was really the only helpful one i found on google, none others really did that.

It might be similar to the IE opener i made a long time ago, but i lost that and dont remember how it worked… oh! its in my tut 1 sec

Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.URL.com");

EDIT: Got it, its just plain “notepad hia.txt” nothing in between

Read full topic
